title: O Panneerselvam, Sasikala fight it out: 5 most important developments from last night you should know : India, News - India Today
text:
A + A - OPS at Jayalaithaa's memorial at Marina Beach. 
If anyone thought Tuesday afternoon's developments were the high point of Tamil Nadu politics, they had another thing coming. 
The drama had only just begun. 
A little past 9 pm, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam made his way to Jayalalithaa's memorial at Marina Beach and sat in silence. That marked the beginning of his unexpected protest. 
After sitting in meditation for more than 40 minutes, OPS told waiting journalists that he was practically usurped from his chief ministerial position. He insisted he was Jayalalithaa's choice for the chief ministerial position and that Sasikala and her supporters threatened and forced him to resign from the top post. 
"I will withdraw my resignation, if people wish... I would fight to save the party and the goodwill of Jayalalithaa's legacy," he said. Tamil Nadu's all like, UP-shoopie. pic.twitter.com/FYl0XUovHb â€” Rohan Venkat (@RohanV) February 7, 2017 
A lot has happened since OPS' surprise protest last night. 
We bring you five top developments: 
Sasikala expels Panneerselvam 
Soon after OPS declared his rebellion, AIADMK general secretary VK Sasikala called for an emergency meeting at Poes Garden. After a three-hour long meet, she came out of her residence and announced to a wave of supporters and media persons that O Pannerselvam will be expelled from his post of AIADMK Treasurer. Now #Sasikala steps out of her house to wave to supporters. What a night. #OPSvsSasikala pic.twitter.com/gXS92KZJMu â€” Shiv Aroor (@ShivAroor) February 7, 2017 
She also accused OPS of conniving with DMK in his rebellion. "In recent assembly session, opposition leader (Stalin) and Pannerselvam exchanged warmth, they were smiling at each other," she told ANI. 
Sasikala maintained there was no rift withing the party and 
Pannerselvam hits back 
Soon after his expulsion from the party post, OPS hit out at Sasikala. "I was appointed treasurer by Amma and no-one can take away my post. I don't fear anybody and DMK is no way involved in it," he said. 
"Wait and see what happens today (Wednesday)," he added. 
OPS becomes an overnight sensation 'Panneerselvam Vazhga' chants outside the MGR/Jaya samadhi. Police presence swells. pic.twitter.com/WINdsSk9sH â€” Shiv Aroor (@ShivAroor) February 7, 2017 O. Panneerselvam's cavalcade gets mobbed by supporters outside the MGR samadhi right now. #OPSvsSasikala pic.twitter.com/oaOruDCJ6o â€” Shiv Aroor (@ShivAroor) February 7, 2017 BJP declares support for OPS OPS has told the press openly that he was compelled to resign by Sasikala's coterie. So the resignation is illegal. OPS sir congrats. â€” H Raja (@HRajaBJP) February 7, 2017 
OPS set to meet the press, TN Governor today 
O Pannerselvam is expected to address the media early Wednesday morning, and give a statement on his expulsion and his next move in the tussle with Sasikala. Heightened security with lots of barricades and cops outside the lane leading to #OPanneerselvam 's house this morning. pic.twitter.com/S0rL0K4Mnr â€” Shiv Aroor (@ShivAroor) February 8, 2017 
A rift may also be in order for AIADMK , as OPS is expected to meet Tamil Nadu Governor Vidyasagar Rao today and brief him about the current political scenario. 
Sources say he will be handing over a list of his supporters, and explain to Rao how he was forcefully made to resign. He is also expected to seek a floor test to prove his majority.
